intro: Andersonia subsessilis, commonly known as the slender Andersonia, is a flowering plant native to Tasmania. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant produces striking, showy inflorescences composed of clusters of small, pink to red flowers. Its leaves are narrow and leathery, adapted to the dry, nutrient-poor soils of its habitat. Andersonia subsessilis is often found in open woodlands and heathlands, thriving in full sun to partial shade.
